question: Nilambur teak known internationally for its superior timber quality has been recently added to the list of products with GI Tag. The tree is predominantly found in which region of India?
explanation: Kerala’s Nilambur teak known internationally for its superior timber quality and elegant appearance has been added to the list of Kerala produces with the Geographical Indication (GI) tag. Nilambur was christened the Mecca of Teak. Due to its superior mechanical and physical properties as well as aesthetic appearance, the teak was exported to England and other parts of the world. It has been recently added into the list of products with GI Tag.
